greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest number k (k>0) such that n*k is a perfect 4th power.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p^((4 - e) mod 4). - _Amiram Eldar_, Sep 08 2020
example: a(64) = 4 because the smallest 4th power divisible by 64 is 256 and 64*4 = 256.
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := p^Mod[4 - e, 4]; a[n_] := Times @@ (f @@@ FactorInteger[n]); Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Sep 08 2020 *)
program: (PARI) a(n,f=factor(n))=f[,2]=-f[,2]%4; factorback(f) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 24 2020
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jun 25 2000
